com.facetec.sdk

Class FaceTecGuidanceCustomization

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facetec.sdk.FaceTecGuidanceCustomization

  • public final class FaceTecGuidanceCustomization
extends java.lang.Object
    Customize the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
    New User Guidance Screens are shown before the Session and Retry Screens are shown after an unsuccessful Session.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int backgroundColors
      Color of the background for the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      This accepts a color or drawable resource id.
      Default is white.
      int buttonBackgroundDisabledColor
      Color of the action button's background when the button is disabled during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Default is custom color.
      int buttonBackgroundHighlightColor
      Color of the action button's background when the button is pressed during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Default is custom color.
      int buttonBackgroundNormalColor
      Color of the action button's background during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Default is custom color.
      int buttonBorderColor
      Color of the action button's border during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Default is transparent.
      int buttonBorderWidth
      Thickness of the action button's border during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
      int buttonCornerRadius
      Corner radius of the action button's border during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
      android.graphics.Typeface buttonFont
      Font of the action button's text during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Default is sans-serif.
      float buttonRelativeWidth
      Control the percent of the available Frame width to use for the action button during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Relative width percent is represented in decimal notation, ranging from 0.0f to 1.0f.
      If the value configured is equal to or greater than 1, the action button will be drawn to at max width within the Frame.
      If the value configured results in a width that is less than the action button's height, the action button's width will equal its height.
      Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.
      int buttonTextDisabledColor
      Color of the action button's text when the button is disabled during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Default is white.
      int buttonTextHighlightColor
      Color of the action button's text when the button is pressed during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Default is white.
      int buttonTextNormalColor
      Color of the action button's text during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Default is white.
      int buttonTextSize
      Size of the action button's text during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e.
      float buttonTextSpacing
      Spacing between characters of the action button's text during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      int cameraPermissionsScreenImage
      Image displayed on the Camera Permissions Screen.
      Default is configured to use image named 'FaceTec_camera' located in application's res/drawable folder.
      boolean enableRetryScreenBulletedInstructions
      Control whether to layout the Retry Screen's instruction messages using bullet-points.
      Applicable localized instruction message strings include: FaceTec_retry_instruction_message_1, FaceTec_retry_instruction_message_2, FaceTec_retry_instruction_message_3.
      If enabled, each instruction message will be placed on a new line, proceeded with a bullet-point, and will not extend to multiple lines.
      If disabled, all instruction messages will be concatenated into a multi-line string.
      Default is true (enabled).
      boolean enableRetryScreenSlideshowShuffle
      Control whether to allow the slideshow images to appear in a randomized order during each Retry Screen.
      Default is true (enabled).
      int foregroundColor
      Color of the text displayed on the New User Guidance and Retry Screens (not including the action button text).
      Note: This customization can be overridden for specific text using FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.readyScreenHeaderTextColor, .readyScreenSubtextTextColor, .retryScreenHeaderTextColor, and/or .retryScreenSubtextTextColor.
      Default is custom color.
      android.graphics.Typeface headerFont
      Font of the title during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Note: This customization can be overridden for specific text using FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.readyScreenHeaderFont and/or .retryScreenHeaderFont.
      Default is sans-serif-medium.
      int headerTextSize
      Size of the title's text during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e.
      float headerTextSpacing
      Spacing between characters of the title during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      java.lang.String readyScreenHeaderAttributedString
      Specify an html-attributed string to use instead of the localized string for the text of the title displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      If this value is an empty string, the localized string, FaceTec_instructions_header_ready, will be used for the text of the title displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Default is an empty string.
      android.graphics.Typeface readyScreenHeaderFont
      Font of the title's text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Note: This will override the header font configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerFont for the Get Ready To Screen.
      If this value is null, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerFont will be used for the font of the title's text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen.
      Default value is null.
      int readyScreenHeaderTextColor
      Color of the header text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Note: This will override the header text color configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor for the Get Ready To Screen.
      If this value is 0 (transparent), FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor will be used for the color of the title's text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen.
      Default value is 0 (transparent).
      int readyScreenHeaderTextSize
      Size of the title's text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e.
      float readyScreenHeaderTextSpacing
      Spacing between the characters of the title's text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      int readyScreenOvalFillColor
      Color of the Get Ready To Screen's oval fill.
      Default is transparent.
      java.lang.String readyScreenSubtextAttributedString
      Specify an html-attributed string to use instead of the localized string for the text of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      If this value is an empty string, the localized string, FaceTec_instructions_message_ready, will be used for the text of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Default is an empty string.
      android.graphics.Typeface readyScreenSubtextFont
      Font of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Note: This will override the title's subtext font configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextFont for the Get Ready To Screen.
      If this value is null, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextFont will be used for the font of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen.
      Default value is null.
      int readyScreenSubtextTextColor
      Color of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Note: This will override the title's subtext color configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor for the Get Ready To Screen.
      If this value is 0 (transparent), FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor will be used for the color of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen.
      Default value is 0 (transparent).
      int readyScreenSubtextTextSize
      Size of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e.
      float readyScreenSubtextTextSpacing
      Spacing between the characters of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      int readyScreenTextBackgroundColor
      Background color of the Get Ready To Screen text views during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      This will only be visible when text is detected as overlapping or too close with the Ready Screen oval.
      Default is white.
      int readyScreenTextBackgroundCornerRadius
      Background corner radius of the Get Ready To Screen text views during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      This will only be visible when text is detected as overlapping or too close with the Get Ready To Screen's oval.
      This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
      java.lang.String retryScreenHeaderAttributedString
      Specify an html-attributed string to use instead of the localized string for the text of the title displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      If this value is an empty string, the localized string, FaceTec_retry_header, will be used for the text of the title displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      Default is an empty string.
      android.graphics.Typeface retryScreenHeaderFont
      Font of the title's text displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      Note: This will override the header font configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerFont for the first Retry Screen.
      If this value is null, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerFont will be used for the font of the title's text displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      Default value is null.
      int retryScreenHeaderTextColor
      Color of the header text displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      Note: This will override the header text color configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor for the first Retry Screen.
      If this value is 0 (transparent), FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor will be used for the color of the title's text displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      Default value is 0 (transparent).
      int retryScreenHeaderTextSize
      Size of the title's text displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e.
      float retryScreenHeaderTextSpacing
      Spacing between the characters of the title's text displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      int retryScreenIdealImage
      Image displayed as Ideal example (right image) during the first Retry Screen.
      Default is configured to use image named 'FaceTec_ideal' located in application's res/drawable folder.
      int retryScreenImageBorderColor
      Color of the image borders during the first Retry Screen.
      Default is custom color.
      int retryScreenImageBorderWidth
      Thickness of the image borders during the first Retry Screen.
      This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e.
      int retryScreenImageCornerRadius
      Corner radius of the image borders during the first Retry Screen.
      int retryScreenOvalStrokeColor
      Color of the oval's stroke that overlay's the Ideal image example during the first Retry Screen.
      Default is white.
      int[] retryScreenSlideshowImages
      Images displayed as Ideal examples (right image) during the first Retry Screen.
      When configured to a non-empty array, these images will override the single image configured for FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.retryScreenIdealImage.
      Default is an empty array.
      int retryScreenSlideshowInterval
      Control the time, in milliseconds, that each image is shown for before transitioning to the next image.
      Default is 1500.
      java.lang.String retryScreenSubtextAttributedString
      Specify an html-attributed string to use instead of the localized string for the text of the title's subtext displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      If this value is an empty string, the localized strings, FaceTec_retry_subheader_message, will be used for the text of the title's subtext displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      Default is an empty string.
      android.graphics.Typeface retryScreenSubtextFont
      Font of the title's subtext and messages displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      Note: This will override the font of the title's subtext and messages configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextFont for the first Retry Screen.
      If this value is null, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextFont will be used for the font of the title's subtext and messages displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      Default value is null.
      int retryScreenSubtextTextColor
      Color of the title's subtext and messages displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      Note: This will override the title's subtext and message color configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor for the first Retry Screen.
      If this value is 0 (transparent), FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor will be used for the color of the title's subtext displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      Default value is 0 (transparent).
      int retryScreenSubtextTextSize
      Size of the title's subtext and messages displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e.
      float retryScreenSubtextTextSpacing
      Spacing between the characters of the title's subtext and messages displayed on the first Retry Screen.
      android.graphics.Typeface subtextFont
      Font of the title's subtext and messages during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      Note: This customization can be overridden for specific text using FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.readyScreenSubtextFont and/or .retryScreenSubtextFont.
      Default is sans-serif-light.
      int subtextTextSize
      Size of the title's subtext and message text during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
      This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e.
      float subtextTextSpacing
      Spacing between characters of the title's subtext and messages during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.

    • Field Detail

      • backgroundColors

        public int backgroundColors
        Color of the background for the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        This accepts a color or drawable resource id.
        Default is white.

      • foregroundColor

        public int foregroundColor
        Color of the text displayed on the New User Guidance and Retry Screens (not including the action button text).
        Note: This customization can be overridden for specific text using FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.readyScreenHeaderTextColor, .readyScreenSubtextTextColor, .retryScreenHeaderTextColor, and/or .retryScreenSubtextTextColor.
        Default is custom color.

      • headerFont

        public android.graphics.Typeface headerFont
        Font of the title during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        Note: This customization can be overridden for specific text using FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.readyScreenHeaderFont and/or .retryScreenHeaderFont.
        Default is sans-serif-medium.

      • headerTextSize

        public int headerTextSize
        Size of the title's text during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_SP).
        Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

      • headerTextSpacing

        public float headerTextSpacing
        Spacing between characters of the title during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens. Only available for API >= 21.
        Note: This customization can be overridden for specific text using FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.readyScreenHeaderTextSpacing and/or .retryScreenHeaderTextSpacing.
        Default is 0.05f.

      • subtextFont

        public android.graphics.Typeface subtextFont
        Font of the title's subtext and messages during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        Note: This customization can be overridden for specific text using FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.readyScreenSubtextFont and/or .retryScreenSubtextFont.
        Default is sans-serif-light.

      • subtextTextSize

        public int subtextTextSize
        Size of the title's subtext and message text during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_SP).
        Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

      • subtextTextSpacing

        public float subtextTextSpacing
        Spacing between characters of the title's subtext and messages during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens. Only available for API >= 21.
        Note: This customization can be overridden for specific text using FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.readyScreenSubtextTextSpacing and/or .retryScreenSubtextTextSpacing.
        Default is 0f.

      • readyScreenHeaderFont

        public android.graphics.Typeface readyScreenHeaderFont
        Font of the title's text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        Note: This will override the header font configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerFont for the Get Ready To Screen.
        If this value is null, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerFont will be used for the font of the title's text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen.
        Default value is null.

      • readyScreenHeaderTextSize

        public int readyScreenHeaderTextSize
        Size of the title's text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_SP).
        If this value is -1, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerTextSize will be used for the size of the title's text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen.
        Default value is -1.

      • readyScreenHeaderTextSpacing

        public float readyScreenHeaderTextSpacing
        Spacing between the characters of the title's text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens. Only available for API >= 21.
        Note: This will override the header text spacing configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerTextSpacing for the Get Ready To Screen.
        If this value is -1f, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerTextSpacing will be used for the character spacing of the title's text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen.
        Default value is -1f.

      • readyScreenHeaderTextColor

        public int readyScreenHeaderTextColor
        Color of the header text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        Note: This will override the header text color configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor for the Get Ready To Screen.
        If this value is 0 (transparent), FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor will be used for the color of the title's text displayed on the Get Ready To Screen.
        Default value is 0 (transparent).

      • readyScreenHeaderAttributedString

        public java.lang.String readyScreenHeaderAttributedString
        Specify an html-attributed string to use instead of the localized string for the text of the title displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        If this value is an empty string, the localized string, FaceTec_instructions_header_ready, will be used for the text of the title displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        Default is an empty string.

      • readyScreenSubtextFont

        public android.graphics.Typeface readyScreenSubtextFont
        Font of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        Note: This will override the title's subtext font configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextFont for the Get Ready To Screen.
        If this value is null, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextFont will be used for the font of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen.
        Default value is null.

      • readyScreenSubtextTextSize

        public int readyScreenSubtextTextSize
        Size of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_SP).
        If this value is -1, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextTextSize will be used for the size of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen.
        Default value is -1.

      • readyScreenSubtextTextSpacing

        public float readyScreenSubtextTextSpacing
        Spacing between the characters of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens. Only available for API >= 21.
        Note: This will override the subtext text spacing configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextTextSpacing for the Get Ready To Screen.
        If this value is -1f, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextTextSpacing will be used for the character spacing of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen.
        Default value is -1f.

      • readyScreenSubtextTextColor

        public int readyScreenSubtextTextColor
        Color of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        Note: This will override the title's subtext color configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor for the Get Ready To Screen.
        If this value is 0 (transparent), FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor will be used for the color of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen.
        Default value is 0 (transparent).

      • readyScreenSubtextAttributedString

        public java.lang.String readyScreenSubtextAttributedString
        Specify an html-attributed string to use instead of the localized string for the text of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        If this value is an empty string, the localized string, FaceTec_instructions_message_ready, will be used for the text of the title's subtext displayed on the Get Ready To Screen during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        Default is an empty string.

      • retryScreenHeaderFont

        public android.graphics.Typeface retryScreenHeaderFont
        Font of the title's text displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Note: This will override the header font configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerFont for the first Retry Screen.
        If this value is null, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerFont will be used for the font of the title's text displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Default value is null.

      • retryScreenHeaderTextSize

        public int retryScreenHeaderTextSize
        Size of the title's text displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_SP).
        If this value is -1, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerTextSize will be used for the size of the title's text displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Default value is -1.

      • retryScreenHeaderTextSpacing

        public float retryScreenHeaderTextSpacing
        Spacing between the characters of the title's text displayed on the first Retry Screen. Only available for API >= 21.
        Note: This will override the header text spacing configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerTextSpacing for the first Retry Screen.
        If this value is -1f, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.headerTextSpacing will be used for the character spacing of the title's text displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Default value is -1f.

      • retryScreenHeaderTextColor

        public int retryScreenHeaderTextColor
        Color of the header text displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Note: This will override the header text color configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor for the first Retry Screen.
        If this value is 0 (transparent), FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor will be used for the color of the title's text displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Default value is 0 (transparent).

      • retryScreenHeaderAttributedString

        public java.lang.String retryScreenHeaderAttributedString
        Specify an html-attributed string to use instead of the localized string for the text of the title displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        If this value is an empty string, the localized string, FaceTec_retry_header, will be used for the text of the title displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Default is an empty string.

      • retryScreenSubtextFont

        public android.graphics.Typeface retryScreenSubtextFont
        Font of the title's subtext and messages displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Note: This will override the font of the title's subtext and messages configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextFont for the first Retry Screen.
        If this value is null, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextFont will be used for the font of the title's subtext and messages displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Default value is null.

      • retryScreenSubtextTextSize

        public int retryScreenSubtextTextSize
        Size of the title's subtext and messages displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        This value is calculated in scaled pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_SP).
        If this value is -1, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextTextSize will be used for the size of the title's subtext and messages displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Default value is -1.

      • retryScreenSubtextTextSpacing

        public float retryScreenSubtextTextSpacing
        Spacing between the characters of the title's subtext and messages displayed on the first Retry Screen. Only available for API >= 21.
        Note: This will override the subtext and message text spacing configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextTextSpacing for the first Retry Screen.
        If this value is -1f, FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.subtextTextSpacing will be used for the character spacing of the title's subtext and messages displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Default value is -1f.

      • retryScreenSubtextTextColor

        public int retryScreenSubtextTextColor
        Color of the title's subtext and messages displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Note: This will override the title's subtext and message color configured with FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor for the first Retry Screen.
        If this value is 0 (transparent), FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.foregroundColor will be used for the color of the title's subtext displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Default value is 0 (transparent).

      • retryScreenSubtextAttributedString

        public java.lang.String retryScreenSubtextAttributedString
        Specify an html-attributed string to use instead of the localized string for the text of the title's subtext displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        If this value is an empty string, the localized strings, FaceTec_retry_subheader_message, will be used for the text of the title's subtext displayed on the first Retry Screen.
        Default is an empty string.

        public int buttonBackgroundHighlightColor

        Default is custom color.

        public int buttonTextDisabledColor

      • buttonBorderWidth

        public int buttonBorderWidth
        Thickness of the action button's border during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_DIP).
        Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

      • buttonCornerRadius

        public int buttonCornerRadius
        Corner radius of the action button's border during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_DIP).
        Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

      • buttonRelativeWidth

        public float buttonRelativeWidth
        Control the percent of the available Frame width to use for the action button during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        Relative width percent is represented in decimal notation, ranging from 0.0f to 1.0f.
        If the value configured is equal to or greater than 1, the action button will be drawn to at max width within the Frame.
        If the value configured results in a width that is less than the action button's height, the action button's width will equal its height.
        Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

      • readyScreenOvalFillColor

        public int readyScreenOvalFillColor
        Color of the Get Ready To Screen's oval fill.
        Default is transparent.

      • readyScreenTextBackgroundColor

        public int readyScreenTextBackgroundColor
        Background color of the Get Ready To Screen text views during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        This will only be visible when text is detected as overlapping or too close with the Ready Screen oval.
        Default is white.

      • readyScreenTextBackgroundCornerRadius

        public int readyScreenTextBackgroundCornerRadius
        Background corner radius of the Get Ready To Screen text views during the New User Guidance and Retry Screens.
        This will only be visible when text is detected as overlapping or too close with the Get Ready To Screen's oval.
        This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_DIP).
        Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

      • retryScreenImageBorderColor

        public int retryScreenImageBorderColor
        Color of the image borders during the first Retry Screen.
        Default is custom color.

      • retryScreenImageBorderWidth

        public int retryScreenImageBorderWidth
        Thickness of the image borders during the first Retry Screen.
        This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_DIP).
        Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

      • retryScreenImageCornerRadius

        public int retryScreenImageCornerRadius
        Corner radius of the image borders during the first Retry Screen. Only available for API >= 21.
        This value is calculated in density/device-independent pixels (i.e. TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_DIP).
        Default is dynamically configured per device at runtime.

      • retryScreenOvalStrokeColor

        public int retryScreenOvalStrokeColor
        Color of the oval's stroke that overlay's the Ideal image example during the first Retry Screen.
        Default is white.

      • retryScreenIdealImage

        @DrawableRes
public int retryScreenIdealImage
        Image displayed as Ideal example (right image) during the first Retry Screen.
        Default is configured to use image named 'FaceTec_ideal' located in application's res/drawable folder.

      • retryScreenSlideshowImages

        @DrawableRes
public int[] retryScreenSlideshowImages
        Images displayed as Ideal examples (right image) during the first Retry Screen.
        When configured to a non-empty array, these images will override the single image configured for FaceTecGuidanceCustomization.retryScreenIdealImage.
        Default is an empty array.

      • retryScreenSlideshowInterval

        public int retryScreenSlideshowInterval
        Control the time, in milliseconds, that each image is shown for before transitioning to the next image.
        Default is 1500.

      • enableRetryScreenSlideshowShuffle

        public boolean enableRetryScreenSlideshowShuffle
        Control whether to allow the slideshow images to appear in a randomized order during each Retry Screen.
        Default is true (enabled).

      • enableRetryScreenBulletedInstructions

        public boolean enableRetryScreenBulletedInstructions
        Control whether to layout the Retry Screen's instruction messages using bullet-points.
        Applicable localized instruction message strings include: FaceTec_retry_instruction_message_1, FaceTec_retry_instruction_message_2, FaceTec_retry_instruction_message_3.
        If enabled, each instruction message will be placed on a new line, proceeded with a bullet-point, and will not extend to multiple lines.
        If disabled, all instruction messages will be concatenated into a multi-line string.
        Default is true (enabled).

      • cameraPermissionsScreenImage

        @DrawableRes
public int cameraPermissionsScreenImage
        Image displayed on the Camera Permissions Screen.
        Default is configured to use image named 'FaceTec_camera' located in application's res/drawable folder.

      • FaceTecGuidanceCustomization

        public FaceTecGuidanceCustomization()
        Constructor for FaceTecGuidanceCustomization object.
